prs.title: feat: add flags to disable broadcast and receiving of tx gossip
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR

This PR adds two flags to disable tx gossip broadcast and tx gossip receiving, respectively. 
- `txgossip.disablebroadcast`: disable broadcast of transactions to other peers
- `txgossip.disablereceiving`: disable receiving of transactions from other peers


## 2. PR title

Your PR title must follow [conventional commits](https://www.convention

prs.title: Added support for fetching grandpa justifications for arbitrary blocks
prs.truncated_body:
# Pull Request type
- [x] Feature

## Description

This feature primarily provides two functionalities:
- A CLI option `--grandpa-justification-period`, allows users to set the block interval at which the node should store block justifications.
- A `grandpa_blockJustification` RPC, enabling users to fetch the justification for a given block number.

## Checklist
- [x] I have performed a

commits.message: integrated grandpa RPC with node RPC
add CLI parameter to configure justification storage period
conditionally enabled the grandpa-justifications feature behind the feature flag
update block justification RPC to return an optional result
remove not used files and fix tests

prs.title: Fix stack overflow in TickArray to TickArrayFacade conversion
prs.truncated_body:
## Problem
The `From<TickArray>` for `TickArrayFacade` implementation had a circular reference causing infinite recursion and stack overflow. Specifically, the implementation called `val.into()`, which is shorthand for `From::from(val)` and looks for a `From<TickArray>` implementation for `TickArrayFacade`, resulting in recursively calling itself. This was confirmed with a test that demonstrated

prs.title: Fix F3 flaky tests
prs.truncated_body:
Remove parallel run for F3 integration tests to avoid stressing the basic CI runners over their limit which results in unstable test run. Compared to main, it makes no difference to the total time it takes for CI test workflow to complete.

Increase the assertion timeout to accommodate slow F3 progress during test with race detector and decrease the eventual check interval to action assertions f

commits.message:
Investigate flaky F3 tests

Attempt to reproduce flaky tests on CI.
Reduce increment and check granularity in tests
Bump CI timeout in checking that tests are unflaked
Re-enable parallel test runs and bump eventual timeout
Tests now look stable, remove the CI flaky test run

prs.title: fix: assert that EC finalized tipset height is never negative in v2 APIs
prs.truncated_body:
Fix an edge case where if the head epoch is below the chain finality policy (defaulting to 900) EC finalized head height would become negative.

Fixes: #13167

commits.message:
Assert that EC finalized tipset height is never negative in v2 APIs

Fix an edge case where if the head epoch is below the chain finality
policy (defaulting to 900) EC finalized head height would become
negative.

Fixes: #13167

prs.title: Staking: make inflation linear after 1.2B total supply
prs.truncated_body:
### What does it do?

This PR adds a new associated type `LinearInflationThreshold` to the `Config` trait of `pallet-parachain-staking`.

Example configurations:
- Moonbase: `Some(1.2B DEV)`
- Moonriver: `Some(1.0B MOVR)`
- Moonbeam: `Some(1.2B GLMR)`

## ⚠️ Breaking Changes ⚠️

When the total supply reaches the configured amount, inflation will becomes linear instead of exponential.

commits.message: Make inflation linear for moonbeam only

prs.title: fix: Allow erasure of web proxy via node update
prs.truncated_body:
There is currently no way to unset a gRPC web proxy endpoint once it has been populated with a previous value. This PR tweaks the node update handler to identify a sentinel value, which will unset the endpoint. Note that the node is still able to differentiate between the sentinel set in the transaction, and the endpoint not being set at all. 

Closes #19780

commits.message:
fix: only accept fully-qualified domain names for web proxy endpoint

Signed-off-by: Matt Hess <matt.hess@swirldslabs.com>

Allow erasure of web proxy via node update

Signed-off-by: Matt Hess <matt.hess@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: fix: Ignore ID literals for individual input parameters
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
Yahcli configuration now supports configuring nonzero shard/realm via its config file, but it's still possible to cause unexpected behavior by specifying a fully-qualified entity ID as an input param (for many different commands). This PR accounts for possible ID literals by stripping said literals of their shard/realm, warning the end user with a console message, and falling bac

prs.title: fix: Only accept fully-qualified domain names for web proxy endpoint
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR further restricts the gRPC web proxy endpoint in node create and node update transactions. The consensus node will now reject the web proxy service endpoint if the endpoint is defined with an IP addresses. Only fully-qualified domain names (FQDNs) are considered valid.

Closes #19751

commits.message:
fix: only accept fully-qualified domain names for web proxy endpoint

Signed-off-by: Matt Hess <matt.hess@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: Single node usage for the whole EthereumFlow
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

Possible scenario:

AccountCreateTransaction is sent to node 1 - SUCCESS
FileCreateTransaction is sent to node 2 - SUCCESS
FileAppendTransaction is sent to node 3 - PAYER_ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND
The last two transactions are part of EthereumFlow execution, where user has no control over which node[s] to use.
<!--
One or two line summary of what this PR does and why it is neede

prs.title: Add signer constructors
prs.truncated_body:
When the signer were part of the community repository, we did not have an upgradeable version. It made sens to not have a constructor, because we wanted to be able to use them in an "initializable" manner, without a key set at construction. This was still not upgrade-friendly because of the lack of namespaced storage.

This PR proposes to align the signers with the normal practice in the library

feat: Add comprehensive DBFT consensus unit tests

- Add 34 comprehensive unit tests covering all DBFT scenarios
- Test normal consensus flows, abnormal scenarios, and recovery mechanisms
- Include Byzantine fault tolerance testing (f=1 and f=2 failures)
- Add network partition and message loss simulation
- Implement stress testing with multiple rounds and large transaction sets
- Create professional test infrastructure with TestWallet and ConsensusTestHelper
- Add comprehensive README documentation
- Ensure 100% test pass rate with robust error handling
- Cover complete DBFT protocol: PrepareRequest → PrepareResponse → Commit flow
- Validate view changes, recovery requests, and state synchronization

Test Coverage:
- UT_ConsensusService.cs (7 tests): Service lifecycle and message handling
- UT_DBFT.cs (6 tests): Basic consensus scenarios
- UT_DBFT_Integration.cs (4 tests): Integration scenarios
- UT_DBFT_NormalFlow.cs (3 tests): Complete normal consensus flows
- UT_DBFT_AbnormalScenarios.cs (4 tests): Failure and attack scenarios
- UT_DBFT_Recovery.cs (6 tests): Recovery mechanisms
- UT_DBFT_Robustness.cs (4 tests): Stress and edge case testing

All tests pass: 34/34 ✅

prs.title: Enhance security analyzer diagnostics with source code context
prs.truncated_body:
Implement debugInfo integration in WriteInTryAnalyzer and ReEntrancyAnalyzer to provide enhanced diagnostic messages with source code locations instead of just instruction addresses.

Features:
- Parse debug information to map instruction addresses to source locations
- Enhanced warning messages with file names, line numbers, and column positions
- Graceful fallback to address-only messages w

commits.message:
Enhance security analyzer diagnostics with source code context

Implement debugInfo integration in WriteInTryAnalyzer and ReEntrancyAnalyzer
to provide enhanced diagnostic messages with source code locations instead
of just instruction addresses.

Features:
- Parse debug information to map instruction addresses to source locations
- Enhanced warning messages with file names, line numbers, and column positions
- Graceful fallback to address-only messages when debug info is unavailable
- Improved recommendations and context for security vulnerabilities
- Comprehensive test coverage for enhanced diagnostic output

This addresses TODO comments in the security analyzers and significantly
improves the developer experience when analyzing smart contract security.

Apply code formatting and clean up enhance-security-diagnostics implementation

- Run dotnet format to ensure consistent code style
- Clean up security analyzer diagnostic enhancements
- Maintain proper formatting for enhanced error messages
- Keep source location mapping functionality intact

Merge dev branch into enhance-security-diagnostics

- Resolved conflicts in Optimizer.cs by choosing Console.WriteLine for logging
- Merged test methods in UnitTest_OptimizerAutomation.cs from both branches
- Combined strategy discovery and validation tests
- Added proper using statements for all required namespaces
Fix logging in Optimizer: use Debug.WriteLine instead of Console.WriteLine

Fix duplicate test methods in UnitTest_OptimizerAutomation

- Remove duplicate Test_StrategyAttributeDiscovery method
- Update Test_StrategyDiscovery to use GetStrategyMethods() helper instead of reflection on private field
- All optimizer automation tests now pass

prs.title: simplify the example structure
prs.truncated_body: This pr focus on making it easier and cleaner for the example project setting and using. also update reference to v3.8.1. instead of from source code.

commits.message: simplify the example structure, to make it easier to build and run examples and uts.
Merge branch 'simplify-examples' of github.com:neo-project/neo-devpack-dotnet into simplify-examples

Revert unnecessary syntax downgrades based on PR feedback

- Reverted string concatenation back to string interpolation
- Reverted explicit constructors back to target-typed new
- Reverted inequality checks back to pattern matching
- Removed manually created artifact file that should be auto-generated

These changes address reviewer concerns about unnecessary conversions
from modern C# syntax to older syntax patterns.

Fix automatic artifact generation system

Updated Directory.Build.props to use local nccs compiler instead of
expecting a global installation. This ensures all smart contract
artifacts are generated automatically during build.

Changes:
- Modified ExecuteBeforeBuild target to use dotnet run with local nccs project
- Updated GenerateSmartContractArtifacts target to use local nccs project
- Regenerated artifacts for HelloWorld and Event examples to demonstrate working system

All example projects now automatically generate:
- .nef files (compiled bytecode)
- .manifest.json files (contract metadata)
- .artifacts.cs files (testing interfaces)

This eliminates the need for manually created artifact files.

prs.title: Enhance error messages with better context and actionable guidance
prs.truncated_body:
## New Features
- Add ErrorMessageBuilder helper class with location-aware error messages
- Enhance CompilationException with factory methods for common error types
- Provide syntax-specific suggestions and type recommendations

## Enhanced Error Messages
- Smart contract validation: Clear steps for fixing inheritance issues
- Unsupported syntax: Location info with file:line:column format

commits.message:
Add enhanced error message infrastructure and core updates

- Add ErrorMessageBuilder helper class for context-aware error messages
- Enhance CompilationException with factory methods for common scenarios
- Update CompilationContext, Expression, and Helper with enhanced error patterns
- Provide location information and actionable guidance for developers

Update expression files with enhanced error messages

- BinaryExpression: improved operator guidance
- LiteralExpression: better type context for defaults
- IdentifierNameExpression: specific symbol guidance
- InvocationExpression: clearer invocation patterns
- MemberExpression: detailed member access help

Complete enhanced error message implementation

- Update ObjectCreationExpression with specific initializer guidance
- Enhance Statement.cs with statement type suggestions
- Improve CallHelpers with parameter and identifier context
- Provide comprehensive error messages across all major compiler components

This completes the enhanced error message feature with actionable guidance
and precise location information for better developer experience.

Update all remaining SyntaxNotSupported errors and apply formatting

- Update SlotHelpers with out parameter guidance
- Update SwitchStatement with label type guidance
- Apply consistent CompilationException.UnsupportedSyntax pattern
- Run dotnet format to ensure code style consistency

This completes the comprehensive enhanced error message implementation
across all 70+ occurrences in the codebase.

Update SDK requirement to use latestPatch rollForward policy

This allows any .NET 9.0.x version (9.0.300 or higher) instead of requiring
exactly 9.0.300, providing more flexibility for developers while maintaining
compatibility with the minimum required features.

Revert SDK rollForward policy back to latestFeature

Restore original global.json configuration as requested.

Verify code formatting with .NET 9.0.301

Ran 'dotnet format' with .NET 9.0.301 - no formatting changes needed.
Code already follows proper formatting standards.

Note: RS1039 analyzer warnings present but no associated code fixes available.

Fix compilation errors: revert ISymbol-based UnsupportedSyntax calls

- Revert to regular CompilationException for ISymbol parameters
- Keep CompilationException.UnsupportedSyntax only for SyntaxNodeOrToken
- Maintain enhanced error messages where appropriate
- Fix all CI build errors while preserving error message improvements
